name: Defying gravity (phenakistoscope)
description: Walking on the walls and dancing on the ceiling.

key_work.title: Phenakistiscope discs
key_work.brief_description: The phenakistoscope is one of the first devices to create the illusion of motion from still images. A stroboscopic cardboard disc is fitted to the device and when seen through the slots, comes to life.

constellations_primary.name: Defying gravity (phenakistoscope)
constellations_primary.description: Walking on the walls and dancing on the ceiling.

start.title: Phenakistiscope discs
start.brief_description: The phenakistoscope is one of the first devices to create the illusion of motion from still images. A stroboscopic cardboard disc is fitted to the device and when seen through the slots, comes to life.

constellations_primary.name: Defying gravity (phenakistoscope)
constellations_primary.description: Walking on the walls and dancing on the ceiling.

end.title: Inception
end.creator_credit: Christopher Nolan, Emma Thomas, Kanjirô Sakura, Yoshikuni Taki, Ian Hunter and Scott Schneider
end.headline_credit: United Kingdom and United States of America, 2010
end.brief_description: Cobb, a skilled thief who commits corporate espionage by infiltrating the subconscious of his targets is offered a chance to regain his old life as payment for a task considered to be impossible: “inception”, the implantation of another person’s idea into a target’s subconscious.

constellations_other.name: Defying gravity (phenakistoscope)
constellations_other.description: Walking on the walls and dancing on the ceiling.

links.description: Phenakistoscope discs spin to give the illusion of motion on the spot. The corridor fight from Inception spins but keeps the camera in one spot to create the illusion of shifting gravity.

start.title: Inception
start.creator_credit: Christopher Nolan, Emma Thomas, Kanjirô Sakura, Yoshikuni Taki, Ian Hunter and Scott Schneider
start.headline_credit: United Kingdom and United States of America, 2010
start.brief_description: Cobb, a skilled thief who commits corporate espionage by infiltrating the subconscious of his targets is offered a chance to regain his old life as payment for a task considered to be impossible: “inception”, the implantation of another person’s idea into a target’s subconscious.

constellations_other.name: Defying gravity (phenakistoscope)
constellations_other.description: Walking on the walls and dancing on the ceiling.

end.title: Royal Wedding
end.brief_description: Fred Astaire (Tom) and Jane Powell (Ellen) are asked to perform as a dance team in England at the time of Princess Elizabeth’s wedding.

constellations_other.name: Defying gravity (phenakistoscope)
constellations_other.description: Walking on the walls and dancing on the ceiling.

links.description: Nolan’s showstopping fight sequence was filmed in a 100-foot rotating corridor, with the camera fixed in place. This was a huge leap from the rotating room set that allowed Fred Astaire to dance on the ceiling in Royal Wedding.

start.title: Royal Wedding
start.brief_description: Fred Astaire (Tom) and Jane Powell (Ellen) are asked to perform as a dance team in England at the time of Princess Elizabeth’s wedding.

constellations_other.name: Defying gravity (phenakistoscope)
constellations_other.description: Walking on the walls and dancing on the ceiling.

end.title: Dancing on the Ceiling
end.brief_description: Before Lionel Ritchie’s hit single from his third album became most recognisable for being. staple of 80s club nights, Dancing on the Ceiling swaggered its way to world domination, charting in countries around the world.

constellations_other.name: Defying gravity (phenakistoscope)
constellations_other.description: Walking on the walls and dancing on the ceiling.

links.description: Lionel Richie hired Royal Wedding director Stanley Donen thirty years later to recreate the rotating room effect for his catchy music video.

start.title: Walking the wall
start.brief_description:
Colour high definition video transferred to media player, stereo sound.

13 min 4 sec.

constellations_other.name: Defying gravity (phenakistoscope)
constellations_other.description: Walking on the walls and dancing on the ceiling.

end.title: Gravity Rush
end.brief_description: Gain a new perspective as you take on the role of Kat, a strong-willed girl seeking the means to protect her future in a world that’s crumbling to pieces. Tilt and move the PlayStation Vita System, taking gravity into your own hands to deliver devastating attacks, uncover the secrets to your past and explore a mysterious world.

constellations_other.name: Defying gravity (phenakistoscope)
constellations_other.description: Walking on the walls and dancing on the ceiling.

links.description: In Gravity Rush, the hero Kat can bend gravity to her will, running up walls and falling from great heights and fiercely does so in a leotard and heels.

start.brief_description: Fred Astaire (Tom) and Jane Powell (Ellen) are asked to perform as a dance team in England at the time of Princess Elizabeth’s wedding.

end.title: Walking the wall

Colour high definition video transferred to media player, stereo sound.

13 min 4 sec.

constellations_other.name: Defying gravity (phenakistoscope)
constellations_other.description: Walking on the walls and dancing on the ceiling.

links.description: It’s said that everything Fred Astaire did, Ginger Rogers did backwards in heels. In Walking the wall, Angela Tiatia endures attempting to walk up a wall in heels, while making constant eye contact with the audience, demanding they witness her contortion.
